intro: Scutellaria lupulina, commonly known as yellow skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or pale green, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Scutellaria lupulina is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, thriving in partial shade. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
